page.title: 19Withybrook PAGE 1
page.content: { Withybrook}is about 8 miles from {Coventry,Nuneaton and Rugby.}A brook, around which grow willow trees, gives the village its name.The first records of Withybrook were made in the 12th century when it started to grow becase of the neighbouring village of{Hopford which was wiped out by the plague. The village also has a spring which joins the brook.The spring has never stopped flowing.Its water is so pure that many people prefer it to tapwater for drinking. The village is in Coventry's green belt.It is mainly farming land,with farms coming to the centre of the village.The soil is crumbly loam,with a pH.of 6.5 to 7.0. Two old buildings remain,the church and an old cottage.This was restored by{Mr & Mrs Lucas.}Mr Lucas was the local black smith.
